What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Improved my knowledge of tenses and got better at speaking and listening.
A deeper understanding of both writing and speaking Spanish.

By taking Spanish S140, I grew a lot more confident in my Spanish. This was the first Spanish course that I took where I felt like I finally had control over all of my tenses. I think above all, this course really helped me develop an appreciation for the Spanish language.
Reading, writing, speaking, and listening skills in Spanish.
Further development of my Spanish knowledge, and better speaking skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: variety of in-class activities, interesting topics, material was covered efficiently
weaknesses: it was sometimes difficult to apply the material we learned about to our own lives
I think that the course was terrific, especially for it being entirely online. The presentations were thorough and planned and the delivery of material was excellent.

Strengths: definitely easier than taking L4 during the school year, exams still feel relatively spaced out even though there is a shorter timeline.
Weaknesses: the course moves really quickly (like a tense a day quickly) and there are a lot of moving parts in the course (e.g. Supersite; reading quizzes; and optional oral and written practice exams).

Strengths: the course is very organized and resources are easily accessible. Professor Diaz and Professor Garcia are both great professors who have their specific style of teaching. There's office hours two times a week and Professor Diaz even added some extra office hours for students who cannot attend the other ones. We receive clear feedbacks for all exercises even if it's just for completion/voluntary. There's always more practices if you ask. Weekly conversations with Yelsy provide more opportunities to practice speaking.

Weaknesses: there are errors sometimes on Canvas.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Not unless they are desperate to finish Spanish
Yes. I felt like I got a lot out of this course in a short amount of time.
Yes, it was a fantastic alternative to the regular semester course and I felt that I learned everything that would have been covered in a fall/spring semester

Yes! This is such a great way to get your L4 language requirement out of the way. I will say that the tests were a bit difficult, but the class felt very laid back and definitely made me feel so much more confident with my Spanish.
Yes, it was very well organized to grow your understanding of the spanish language.

YES, this is a great course for students who want to improve their Spanish. Sometimes it's hard to motivate yourself to self-study a language, but this course has all the resources you need. The curriculum is developed with the students in mind, and if you put in the work given or more there is no doubt your Spanish will improve.
Yes, I think it was a good course to improve my Spanish
